channel.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
channel.description:
Some of the responses in [this thread](https://disco.auxy.co/t/how-do-you-figure-out-your-songs-genre/4395/) have led me to wonder about the roles/presence of 'genre' and 'inspiring ideas' at the very start of each new, original track each of us makes.
  Which [u]one[/u] of these options best reflects how you most commonly [u]_**start**_[/u] a new track.
  [poll type=regular] * I have a genre, but I don't have an idea * I have a genre and I have an idea * I have an idea, but I don't have a genre * I don't have an idea and I don't have a genre (blank slate) [/poll]
I'll keep it anonymous for now, but may reveal how people voted later.

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Need to choose which you think you do more than the others, even if only slightly.

If it really is evenly split, imagine which one you’d pick if you could only use one approach for the next six month.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: ST3R30
item.description:
same, i almost always start off with chords then add drums, then a bassline

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: Andrew_Adams
item.description:
I think I need an all of the above option. I don’t always do the same process. Sometimes I have an idea going into it, sometimes I don’t.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
I start with nothing. Just a bpm im feeling and a key. Though I usually try and make the drop first and work my way around that. Maybe it’s a bit of an odd way of doing things, but it works for me.
It’s like, this way, I know what the climax of the track is supposed to be like, then I can work to build up to it and break it down

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
No idea, no genre. Just start writing and once I like something I put down I go from there.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: DontPartyWithGuns
item.description:
My process;

  1. write a stupid melody
  2. add a bass and more layers
  3. decide what genre would fit it best
  4. make it that genre
  5. song complete

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: xavior
item.description:
Sometimes I’ll be developing an idea and the track might change genres two or more times, depending on how I experiment and direct it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Same here. Or drums. Back in desktop DAW land I usually start with chords or a loop (synth or drums). Beats tend to be the backbone.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you start a new track? [Poll]

item.description:
I always start with chords

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: Produk
item.description:
I have an idea and I have a genre, 50% of the time.

Mostly it’s just flailing.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you start a new track? [Poll]
item.dc:creator: anon38751485
item.description:
I really want ideas…

As for this, I’m having a lot of hardships.
If that is excellent, I may not have any difficulties.
